title: Government tightens rules for NH maintenance
description: The Indian road transport ministry has made it mandatory for contractors and agencies to provide evidence of time-stamped and geo-tagged photos of 'before works and after maintenance' when submitting bills for National Highways. The move comes in response to complaints about poor maintenance and a focus on construction rather than upkeep. The decision will affect around 10-15% of the 1.5 lakh km network and will primarily focus on highways converted from state highways to National Highways.

title: Government unveils draft norms to help earn ‘green credits’
description: The Indian environment ministry has released two draft methodologies for generating green credits through water harvesting and tree plantation projects. The initiatives are part of the Green Credit Programme (GCP), which aims to promote environmentally friendly practices across the country. The drafts list appropriate structures and species for action by individuals, cooperatives, and local bodies.

title: Cancer cases in India estimated to rise from 14 lakh per year to 20 lakh
description: The incidence rate of cancer in India has not increased as rapidly as in the West, but the absolute number of new cases is rising due to population growth and better diagnoses. Currently, 1.4 million new cases are detected each year, projected to increase to 2 million by 2040. The highest incidence rates are found in the Northeastern states, but even large metropolitan areas have rates within the range of 100-110 per 100,000. While cervical cancer rates have declined, breast, lung, and oral cancer continue to rise. The increase in absolute numbers is placing a burden on healthcare facilities, prompting the recommendation for the government to subsidize the establishment of more cancer hospitals.

title: CIC may become defunct on Tuesday as terms of 3 ICs end
description: The Central Information Commission (CIC) in India is at risk of becoming defunct as the terms of the remaining three information commissioners are set to end on Monday. The CIC has been without a chief for a month since YK Sinha's tenure ended. The Prime Minister-led selection committee has already met to discuss the appointment of new commissioners. If appointments are not made by Monday, the commission will be left with no commissioners.

title: A Hachiko in Kerala: This dog has been waiting outside mortuary for 4 months
description: A dog has been waiting outside a hospital mortuary in Kerala's Kannur district for nearly four months. The hospital authorities believe that the dog's owner may have died and been taken to the morgue. The dog, named "Ramu" by a doctor who provides him with food, stays near the ramp leading to the mortuary, hoping for his master's return. Despite being offered food, Ramu remains loyal and refuses to leave. A woman has approached the hospital to adopt him.

title: Jaishankar reiterates India’s stance in talks with Israeli counterpart
description: Indian Foreign Minister S Jaishankar spoke to his Israeli counterpart Eli Cohen, expressing India's condemnation of terrorism and support for a two-state solution. They also emphasized the importance of international humanitarian law. India has been engaging with stakeholders to defuse the situation in Gaza, including conversations between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, as well as UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan. The leaders condemned Hamas's attacks on Israel and stressed that Hamas does not represent the Palestinian people.

title: Congress names 23 in 6th list, controversial mantri out
description: Congress released its sixth list of 23 candidates late Saturday for the Rajasthan polls, dropping controversial minister Mahesh Joshi. With this, the party has declared nominees for 179 of the 200 seats in the state. Joshi was seeking a ticket from Jaipur's Hawa Mahal seat. He has been replaced by Congress city chief R R Tiwari. Tiwari, though, had filed his papers earlier in the day, even before the official list was issued. BJP has fielded a preacher, Balmukund Acharya, from this seat.

title: Army set to induct 1st batch of Apache attack helicopters
description: The Indian Army is preparing to induct six Apache attack helicopters armed with Stinger air-to-air missiles, Hellfire Longbow air-to-ground missiles, guns, and rockets. The deliveries of the helicopters, which are often referred to as "tanks in the air," will take place between February and June next year. This comes as the Army and the Indian Air Force have finalized plans to order 156 indigenous 'Prachand' light combat helicopters.

title: Germany's Hamburg airport closed after armed man breaches security
description: The airport in the northern German city of Hamburg was closed to passengers, and flights were canceled Saturday night after a vehicle broke through security and entered the premises, German news agency dpa reported. Federal police said an armed man had broken through a gate with his vehicle and fired twice into the air with a weapon. Police also said that the man’s wife had previously contacted them about a possible child abduction. Several local German media reported that the man had two children inside his car.

title: Sailor killed in Kochi copter accident
description: A sailor was killed on Saturday in an accident involving a Chetak helicopter during its ground taxi maintenance at the naval air station INS Garuda at Kochi. A board of inquiry has been ordered to probe the accident in which the sailor, leading air mechanic Yogendra Singh, was killed at around 2 pm on the runway at INS Garuda, which is adjacent to the Southern Naval Command headquarters at Kochi. “The accident took place on the ground... the chopper was not flying,” an officer said.

title: Two held from Telangana & Gujarat for threat emails to Ambani
description: Two youths from Telangana and Gujarat have been arrested by Mumbai police for sending threatening emails to Reliance Industries chairman, Mukesh Ambani. The emails demanded a total of Rs 900 crore from Ambani, with the threat of harm if he failed to pay. The investigation revealed that the two accused did not know each other and were working independently.

title: Legislature cannot overrule a judgment: CJI Chandrachud
description: Chief Justice of India D Y Chandrachud stated that while a court's judgment cannot be directly overruled, the legislature can pass new laws to address any deficiencies in the judgment. He emphasized that judges are guided by constitutional morality rather than public morality. Chandrachud also discussed the need to redefine merit in an inclusive sense to increase female representation in the judiciary.

title: Nuclear source lying in Mum institute’s basement since 1980s to be moved out
description: The Institute of Science in Mumbai will be relocating a nuclear source, Californium-252 and Plutonium Beryllium, from its campus. The source, which has completed 14 half lives, is the last remnant of the institute's nuclear chemistry laboratory, which was established in 1962 but declined due to lack of funds and attention. The institute plans to expand its research in high-end areas after the source is safely removed. The decline of the institute began when the state government excluded research from a teacher's workload for salary purposes.

title: Ahead of polls, Maoists kill BJP leader in Bastar
description: On Saturday, Maoists killed Ratan Dubey, the vice-president of the BJP in Narayanpur district, in full public view. Dubey is the second BJP leader to be killed in Bastar in two weeks and the seventh this year. The murder occurred after Dubey addressed an election rally and a group of men chased and shot him before hacking him to death. The Maoists had previously issued a threat to political workers and candidates in the region.

title: ED working for BJP’s benefit, I was always their target: CM Baghel
description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has accused the Enforcement Directorate (ED) of targeting him for political gain ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. Baghel claimed that independent agencies were being compromised and that the timing of the ED's actions and the Mahadev App case raised questions. He also insinuated that the ED's allegations were orchestrated to tarnish his image.

title: Electric planes, once a fantasy, start to take to the skies
description: Beta Technologies, a Vermont-based company, recently completed a 16-day journey down the East Coast of the United States in its battery-powered aircraft, the CX300. The trip showcased the potential of electric aviation, which aims to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions from air travel. Beta has raised over $800 million from investors and plans to mass-produce its aircraft in a new factory. Other companies, including Joby Aviation and Archer Aviation, are also developing electric aircraft with support from major investors.

title: Don’t fly Air India after November 19, life at risk: Pannun to Sikhs
description: The Canada-based terrorist outfit 'Sikhs For Justice' has warned Sikhs not to fly on Air India planes after November 19, evoking memories of the 1985 bombing of Air India's Boeing 747 'Kanishka'. The group's leader, Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, stated that there would be a global blockade preventing Air India from flying, and called for the closure of the Indira Gandhi International Airport on that day. Pannun's warnings and actions mirror those of the late Babbar Khalsa chief Talwinder Singh Parmar, who orchestrated the Kanishka bombing.

title: With ‘GPS anklets’, cops to monitor terror-accused on bail
description: Jammu and Kashmir Police will now use GPS tracker devices fitted on anklets to monitor terror-accused individuals out on bail. This move, a first in India, aims to prevent accused persons from jumping bail. The anklet tracker was first worn by Ghulam Mohammed Bhat, an operative linked to Hizbul Mujahideen, who is accused in a 2007 terror financing case. The use of GPS trackers for monitoring accused persons on bail is already common in countries like the US, UK, South Africa, Australia, and New Zealand.

title: Free ration scheme to be extended 5 more years: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced the extension of the PM Garib Kalyan Ann Yojna (PMGKAY) scheme, which provides free foodgrains to over 80 crore poor people, for the next five years. The scheme, expected to cost Rs 2 lakh crore annually in subsidies, will fortify Modi's "pro-poor" platform ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

title: Tiffin box with 2kg IED planted on NH stretch in Jammu
description: A major tragedy was averted on Saturday with the timely detection and destruction of a timer-based improvised explosive device (IED) that had been concealed in a tiffin box and planted along the Sidhra-Narwal stretch of the Jammu-Srinagar national highway near a police checkpoint.

title: Cong releases 6th list of 22 candidates for Rajasthan polls
description: The Congress party has released its sixth list of candidates for the Rajasthan assembly elections, with 22 nominees. Minister Mahesh Joshi, who represented the Hawa Mahal constituency, has not been given a ticket. R R Tiwari has been nominated in his place. The party has now declared its candidates for 178 out of 200 seats. The Rajasthan Assembly elections will take place on November 25 and the counting of votes will be on December 3.

title: NYT writer quits after accusing Israel of ‘genocide’
description: Jazmine Hughes, a staff writer for the New York Times Magazine, resigned after violating the company's policy by signing an open letter accusing Israel of genocide against Palestinians. The letter, titled "Writers Against the War on Gaza," blamed Israel for deaths in a terrorist attack by Hamas. The conflict between Israel and Gaza has led to restrictions on freedom of expression, with many institutions dealing with members who feel strongly about the conflict. Hughes had previously criticized her newspaper's op-ed desk for publishing a column by Senator Tom Cotton.

title: Jaishankar on row with Canada: 'They may have their concerns but it can't be that ...'
description: S Jaishankar has stated that there is room for diplomacy to address the ongoing bilateral row between India and Canada. The relationship between the two countries deteriorated after Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau alleged Indian involvement in the killing of a Khalistani terrorist. India rejected the allegations and called them absurd. Jaishankar emphasized that sovereignty and sensitivity cannot be one-way streets and expressed hope for a resolution. Canada has withdrawn 41 diplomats from India, and visa services have recently been resumed.

title: WhatsApp's AI shows kid with gun when prompted with 'Palestine'
description: WhatsApp's AI image generator feature has come under scrutiny after it produced disturbing images when prompted with terms related to the Israel-Hamas conflict. When prompted with terms like "Palestinian" or "Muslim boy Palestinian," the AI generated images of guns or boys with guns. However, when prompted with terms like "Israeli army," the AI created drawings of soldiers without guns. The parent company, Meta, has acknowledged the issue and stated that they are working to improve the feature. Additionally, Instagram has also faced criticism for translating "Palestinian" to "Palestinian terrorist" in Arabic text, which the company attributed to a glitch.

title: Australia knock defending champions England out of World Cup
description: Adam Zampa delivered three crucial breakthroughs during the middle overs as Australia eliminated the defending champions England from the ODI World Cup with a 33-run triumph on Saturday, securing their fifth consecutive victory. Despite some missed opportunities to convert their starts, the Australian batsmen managed to post a total of 286 against their arch-rivals, with Marnus Labuschagne contributing his highest score of the tournament, 71 off 83 balls.

title: Elvish Yadav briefly stopped by police in Rajasthan's Kota
description: Popular YouTuber Elvish Yadav was briefly detained by police in Kota, Rajasthan, during a routine check. The Noida Police had booked Yadav and arrested five others over allegations of using snake venom at rave parties. However, he was later allowed to go as the Noida Police confirmed that he was not wanted and the case was still under investigation. Yadav has denied the charges and expressed his willingness to cooperate with the police. The police will continue to collect evidence and investigate his role in the case.

title: BB 17: Wildcard contestant Manasvi gets evicted from house
description: In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 17, Salman Khan confronts several contestants for having a conversation before entering the house. However, no stern steps are taken against them due to their honesty. Musician King enters the house and plays a game with the contestants, leading to arguments between Abhishek and Tahlka, as well as Sana and Ankita. Salman announces Manasvi as the evicted contestant. Manasvi had controversial arguments with Anurag and violated the rules by damaging Bigg Boss's property.

title: Punjab farmers force govt official to burn crop residue
description: The official, Public Works Department (PWD) Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) Harpreet, tried hard not to burn the collected residue but the farmers insisted for it and forcibly handed over match box to him to start the fire. The official had to act as their diktats.

title: Isro chief Somanath withholds book release amid row
description: The chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), S Somanath, has decided to withhold the release of his upcoming book, titled "Nilavu Kudicha Simhangal" ("Lions that drank the moonlight"), due to controversy surrounding its content. Somanath clarified that the purpose of the book was to inspire young people and not to target anyone in particular. He expressed regret that the reported excerpts had caused unnecessary harm to former chairman K Sivan and stated that he would make a decision later regarding the book's release.

title: Zaman keeps Pakistan alive at World Cup
description: Pakistan endured a battering by New Zealand's top-order before launching their own onslaught through centurion Fakhar Zaman to win a rain-hit World Cup game by 21 runs via the DLS method on Saturday and stay alive in the hunt for a semi-final spot. The fourth straight defeat for the Kiwis meant that South Africa became the second team after India to qualify for the semis. Pakistan, New Zealand and Afghanistan now have eight points each and remain in contention for semi-final spots alongside Australia.

title: Maoists kill another BJP leader in Bastar ahead of polls
description: According to initial reports, Ratan Dubey, the BJP worker active as district vice-president and Zila panchayat member, was addressing an election rally in Dhaudai region near Kaushalnagar in Narayanpur. Five kilometres from Jharghati police station, BJP worker Ratan Dubey who had gone out for election campaign was killed by unidentified Maoists using a sharp-edged weapon, a police statement said.

title: Kohli not thinking too much about record-equalling ton: Dravid
description: Virat Kohli approached his 49th ODI century, a milestone that would have drawn him level with Sachin Tendulkar's record. However, the star Indian batsman fell short of achieving this milestone, getting dismissed for 95 against New Zealand and 88 against Sri Lanka in separate World Cup matches. Kohli will get another opportunity to make history on his birthday when India face South Africa at Eden Gardens on Sunday. Nonetheless, head coach Rahul Dravid believes that the former captain doesn't dwell on achieving a century or even on his birthday.

title: School principal held for sexually assaulting 60 minor girls in Haryana
Why US MQ-9 Reaper drones are flying missions over Gaza
description: The US military is using unarmed MQ-9 Reaper drones to assist in locating hostages taken by Hamas in Gaza. At least six drones have been deployed, flying at an altitude of 25,000 feet for about three hours at a time. The drones are providing planning and intelligence support to the Israeli military. MQ-9 Reaper drones have the ability to loiter at altitudes of 50,000 feet for over 27 hours, gathering intelligence with advanced cameras, sensors, and radars. They are cost-effective and do not require a pilot to operate.

title: New Ultraviolette electric motorcycle with 200+ kmph top speed
description: Bengaluru-based EV startup Ultraviolette Automotive will debut a new electric bike at EICMA 2023. The teaser video showcases the bike's sleek design and powerful acceleration, with a top speed anticipated to reach 200 kmph.

title: BRI woes continue: After Italy, Philippines deals fresh blow to Xi's $1 trillion 'project of century'
Former Guinea dictator escapes from prison
Guinean ex-dictator Camara recaptured, in jail: Army, lawyer
description: Guinean former dictator Moussa Dadis Camara has been recaptured and returned to prison the army and his lawyer said on Saturday after an apparent jailbreak led by a heavily-armed commando. "Captain Moussa Dadis Camara has been found safe and sound and taken back to prison," an army spokesperson told AFP, without specifying the circumstances of the capture. He was taken from prison by a heavily armed commando during an operation that sparked heavy gunfire in the capital Conakry, a minister and lawyers said earlier today.

title: Rahul Gandhi urges PM Modi to change mindset on Adivasis
description: He said the Congress party will eliminate the term "Vanvasi" from the country and stand by "Adivasi". The party will protect the "Jal-Jungle-Jameen" of the Adivasis, in contrast to the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which aims to make Adivasis beg by taking their lands and giving them to corporate interests. During the BJP rule in Chhattisgarh, tribals used to be killed, he claimed.

title: 'Malicious act': China, Canada lock horns over chopper incident
description: China's defense ministry has criticized Canada for jeopardizing its sovereignty and security by flying a helicopter close to its territory in the South China Sea. This comes after Canada accused Chinese warplanes of buzzing a Canadian helicopter and firing flares at it. China stated that the Canadian helicopter violated Chinese and international laws, calling it a "malicious" and "provocative" act. The Canadian defense minister described the Chinese maneuvers as significantly unsafe and a risk to personnel.

title: Sri Lanka cancels WC training due to Delhi air pollution
description: As the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded 407 in the morning, Sri Lanka also chose to remain indoors on Saturday. An official from the Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) commented, "It was canceled due to the air quality issue," referring to the cancellation of Saturday's training session.

title: Jailed UP don and 4-time MLA Vijay Mishra gets 15 years in jail in rape case
Why Pakistanis are weary of army growing food
description: The food crisis in Pakistan has led to the country's army taking control of vast amounts of land for cultivation. Pakistan ranks 102 out of 125 nations in the Global Hunger Index, and currently faces a situation where it is food sufficient but not food secure. In an attempt to alleviate food insecurity and restore its image, the army has taken on a central role in improving the situation. The army has been given land in Punjab and South Waziristan for cultivation, although concerns have been raised about transparency and potential profits for the military.

title: Shaheen Afridi creates unwanted World Cup record for Pakistan
description: Shortly after ascending to the top position as the ODI's premier bowler, Pakistan's primary fast bowler, Shaheen Shah Afridi, experienced a significant downturn. This unfortunate turn of events occurred during the ODI World Cup match against New Zealand in Bengaluru. In a historic context, Shaheen, a left-arm pacer, etched his name in the record books for all the wrong reasons, as he yielded an unprecedented 90 runs in his 10 overs without managing to claim a wicket, marking the poorest performance by a Pakistan bowler in the annals of the ODI World Cup.

title: Telangana student held for sending threat mails to Mukesh Ambani
description: The individual, identified as Ganesh R Vanpardhi, hailing from Telangana, was located by the Gamdevi police with the help of technical expertise and subsequently transported to Mumbai on Saturday.

title: Chetak helicopter crashes at naval air station in Kochi
description: A Chetak helicopter crashed on the runway of the naval air station, INS Garuda, in Kochi on Saturday.

title: 4 dead, 7 missing in pharma factory fire in Maharashtra's Raigad
description: The fire erupted at Blue Jet Healthcare, situated in the Mahad MIDC area of Raigad, at approximately 11 am on Friday. The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) official shared this information.

title: Pak ex-min Fawad Chaudhry arrested from Islamabad, says wife
description: Pakistan's former minister for Information and Broadcasting, Fawad Chaudhry, was arrested from his home in Islamabad on Saturday, Geo News reported. His wife, Hiba Fawad Chaudhary confirmed his arrest in a post on X, formerly Twitter, where she said, "Fawad arrested and taken to unknown place." "He was arrested by police and men wearing plain clothes," she also said in a statement to Geo News, and added, "We have not been told why Fawad is being arrested."

title: 'Rachin goes past Sachin': Ravindra sets WC records with third century
description: New Zealand's Rachin Ravindra made history by scoring his third century of the World Cup in a crucial match against Pakistan. Ravindra scored 108 runs off 94 balls, featuring a six and 15 fours. With this century, Ravindra became the player with the most World Cup hundreds before turning 25, surpassing legendary Sachin Tendulkar. He also equaled Tendulkar's record for the most runs in a single World Cup edition before turning 25, and now has the opportunity to break this record in his next innings.

title: Vast deep tunnels, guerrilla tactics: How Hamas aims to trap Israel in Gaza quagmire
description: Hamas has prepared for a long, drawn-out war in the Gaza Strip and believes it can hold up Israel's advance long enough to force its arch enemy to agree to a ceasefire, two sources close to the organization's leadership said. Hamas, which rules Gaza, has stockpiled weapons, missiles, food and medical supplies, according to the people, who declined to be named due to the sensitivity of the situation. The group is confident its thousands of fighters can survive for months in a city of tunnels carved deep beneath the Palestinian enclave and frustrate Israeli forces with urban guerrilla tactics, the people told Reuters.

title: Newlywed Varun Tej and Lavanya make their first public appearance
description: Affter the grand wedding in Italy, Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi reach Hyderabad, and they newlywed spotted at the Hyderabad airport. Fans gave the couple a grand welcome.

title: Centre to extend free ration scheme for next 5 years: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said that Centre's free ration scheme will be extended by 5 more years, and 80 crore people will benefit from it. The Prime Minister made the announcement while addressing a rally in poll-bound Chhattisgarh. PM Modi also took a swipe at the Congress, accusing it prioritising financial gains and frequently engaging in corrupt activities. "Congress hates self-respecting and confident poor. It always wants the poor to stand before him and plead, so it wants to keep the poor, poor," he said.

title: Smriti Irani slams Baghel over Rs500 crore kickbacks
description: Union minister Smriti Irani has accused Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel of receiving a Rs 500 crore kickback for the Congress party's election campaign. Irani alleged that the party used hawala transactions to fund its campaign in the state. The Enforcement Directorate has arrested a cash courier boy who was delivering a large sum of cash for election expenses. The ED claims that a total of Rs 508 crore was disbursed to Baghel by the promoters of the Mahadev betting app. The chief minister has accused the BJP of targeting him through central investigation agencies.

title: Smriti Irani slams Bhupesh Baghel after ED's claims
description: Union minister Smriti Irani has accused Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel of receiving a Rs 500 crore kickback for the Congress party's election campaign. Irani alleged that the party used hawala transactions to fund its campaign in the state. The Enforcement Directorate has arrested a cash courier boy who was delivering a large sum of cash for election expenses. The ED claims that a total of Rs 508 crore was disbursed to Baghel by the promoters of the Mahadev betting app. The chief minister has accused the BJP of targeting him through central investigation agencies.

title: Massive discounts of up to Rs 3.5 lakh on Mahindra SUVs this Diwali
description: Mahindra & Mahindra is offering significant discounts on select SUVs this Diwali. Discounts range from Rs 50,000 to Rs 3.5 lakh on models like the XUV300, Bolero, Bolero Neo, Marazzo, and the all-electric XUV400.

title: Rishab Shetty takes a stand against piracy, backs govt initiative
description: Rishab Shetty, known for his acting, directing, and writing skills, gained recognition through his film Kantara. He has also shown his commitment to the entertainment industry by speaking out against piracy and supporting government efforts to combat it. In addition to his professional life, Rishab values his family and enjoys spending time with them. He is currently working on a prequel to Kantara, and fans are eager to see what captivating storyline he will deliver next.

title: Elon Musk's xAI releases 'Gork,' it's ChatGPT rival
description: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has unveiled its first AI model, called Gork, to a select group. Gork is a large language model with real-time access to information through xAI's social media platform. Musk shared examples of Gork's sarcastic responses to user queries, expressing his admiration for the model's wit. He also praised xAI's platform, claiming it is among the best available. Currently, Gork is only accessible to a limited number of people, but Musk plans to release it to X Premium+ subscribers in the future.

title: PM Modi writes letter to Chhattisgarh girl who drew his sketch
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote a letter to a young girl from Kanker, Chhattisgarh, who had presented him with a sketch during a public rally. The sketch, created by Akanksha Thakur, captured the Prime Minister's interest while he was addressing the crowd during an election rally in Kanker. He paused his public address, requesting security personnel to bring him the sketch. During this PM Modi requested Akanksha to write her address on the back of the sketch so that he could write her a letter.

title: Mukesh Ambani receives fresh threat emails after Rs 400cr demand
description: The sender of the email also warned of serious consequences for ignoring previous emails.

title: 'Tough to digest...': Hardik after being ruled out of World Cup
description: India's vice-captain, Hardik Pandya, has been ruled out of the World Cup due to an ankle injury sustained last month. The International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the decision and approved Prasidh Krishna as Pandya's replacement. Pandya's injury occurred during a match against Bangladesh, leading to his absence in subsequent matches against England, New Zealand, and Sri Lanka. The star all-rounder expressed his support on social media. Before his injury, Pandya picked up five wickets in India's first three matches.

title: Elon Musks says his ChatGPT type AI has a sense of humour, shares response to this cocaine query
description: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup, xAI, is launching its beta version. Musk's first AI model will be released to a select group on November 4th. The xAI model has been teased by Musk on his X platform, where he shared its humor traits. Musk believes that xAI is the best AI model currently available. Once out of beta, xAI's Grok system will be available to all X Premium+ subscribers. X, formerly Twitter, recently introduced subscription plans for ad-free experiences.

title: Rohit Roy: If I was hungry, would have bungalows next to Amitabh
description: In this week's Big Interview, ETimes brings to you Rohit Roy who talks about his career from television to movies to theatre to OTT. The actor gets candid about his achievements, regrets, struggles and lots more in this chat. Read on...

title: Is your car air-purifier lying to you? Myths busted
description: Car air purifiers are popular for improving in-car air quality, but there are myths that need to be addressed.

title: NE Diary: Why Mizo parties want to keep a safe distance from BJP
description: The Zoram People's Movement (ZPM), a young regional party in Mizoram, aims to challenge the ruling Mizo National Front (MNF) in the upcoming assembly polls. The ZPM emerged as the main opposition party in 2018, winning eight seats and relegating the Congress to third place. The party's chief ministerial candidate, Lalduhoma, has stated that the ZPM will maintain its independent regional identity and will not align with either the BJP-led NDA or the opposition INDIA bloc.

title: 'Beizzati apni toh karaani hi karaani...': Akram on 'different balls' theory
description: A conspiracy theory in Pakistan suggests that Indian pacers are successful in the ODI World Cup due to a different set of balls from the ICC. Former Pakistan cricketer Hasan Raza fueled this theory with a controversial remark on Pakistan TV. A Pakistani fan asked the same question to bowling legend Wasim Akram during a discussion on 'A Sports'. Akram argued that the idea is absurd and that the minds of the conspiracy theorists are not present. Pakistan great also explained why it is an absurd suggestion.

title: Air Force base attacked in central Pak, 3 terrorists killed
Injured Hardik Pandya ruled out of World Cup
description: India's all-rounder Hardik Pandya has been ruled out of the ICC World Cup 2023 due to an ankle injury. The tournament's technical committee approved India's request to replace him with Prasidh Krishna, who has played only 17 ODIs and 2 T20Is for India. Krishna has taken 33 international wickets, but his chances of getting into the playing eleven are doubtful due to India's pace department's impressive run to reach the semi-finals. India lead the 10-team table with 14 points and have round-robin matches left against South Africa (Nov 5) and the Netherlands (Nov 12).

title: Indian fast bowling attack big reason for team's unbeaten run
description: Mohammed Shami's impressive performance in the match against Sri Lanka showcased his rhythm and skill in pace bowling. With his relentless wicket-taking ability, Shami became the highest wicket-taker for India in World Cups. His partnership with Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj has created a formidable bowling attack for India. The team's success in bowling out five teams in seven games is a testament to their skill and effectiveness. Bowling out five teams in seven games proves that.

title: 'Public money worth Rs 5,716cr part of Jet crime proceeds'
description: Jet Airways founder Naresh Goyal, his wife Anita Goyal, and four companies have been charged with obtaining public money worth Rs. 5,716 crore through criminal activity, according to a special PMLA court in Mumbai. The chargesheet alleges that the funds were diverted through inflated sales commissions, payouts to professionals, loans to subsidiary JetLite, and writing off loans in balance sheets. Goyal was arrested in September and is currently in judicial custody. The court has issued summons to Anita Goyal and the four companies. The chargesheet is connected to a Rs. 539 crore Canara Bank loan.

title: Here’s how people with disabilities can stay safe online
description: People with disabilities (PWDs) are increasingly being targeted by cyber attacks. Factors contributing to this include their use of assistive technologies, lack of awareness about cyber threats, and targeted phishing attacks. Scammers often pose as representatives and exploit PWDs' vulnerabilities. To stay safe, PWDs should verify the recipient before sharing confidential information and be aware of different types of threats. They should avoid clicking on suspicious links or downloading applications from unknown sources. If victimized, PWDs should report the cyber attack. Organizations serving PWDs should also implement strong security measures, educate employees, and provide information to clients about cyber security.

title: Why Airtel, Reliance Jio and Vodafone have raised national security concerns over these messages from Amazon, Microsoft, others
description: The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) has accused tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft of bypassing legal telecom routes by using WhatsApp and other unregulated platforms to send enterprise messages to customers. In a letter to the telecom secretary, COAI argues that this practice violates licensing and security norms, resulting in a loss of revenue for the government and telecom companies. COAI also warns that this could pose a national security threat and lead to a potential revenue loss of Rs 3,000 crore. The use of unlicensed routes to send international messages has also been highlighted by telcos.

title: Minor raped & sold by dad, forced into flesh trade by spouse
description: A minor girl in Varanasi was raped by her father for over two years before being sold to a man in Ghazipur in the name of marriage. The husband forced her into prostitution and abandoned her when she couldn't terminate her pregnancy. The girl sought help from the district legal services authority, who informed the police and both the father and husband were taken into custody. An FIR has been lodged against them under various sections of the IPC and POCSO. Investigation is underway.

title: Is Taj Mahal 'renovated palace'? Decide on claim, HC tells ASI
description: The Delhi High Court has asked the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to address a representation by NGO Hindu Sena, which claims that Mughal emperor Shah Jahan did not build the Taj Mahal but only renovated the palace of Raja Man Singh. The representation alleges that incorrect historical information is being taught about the monument and seeks its removal from educational materials. The court has asked ASI to investigate the claims and make a decision.

title: SC upholds HC CJ’s order to take Gyanvapi case from judge
description: The Supreme Court of India has upheld the decision to withdraw the case regarding the religious character of the Gyanvapi mosque from Justice Prakash Padia. The case involves claims by Hindus that the mosque was built on the site of the ancient Vishwanath Temple. The petition to challenge the withdrawal of the case was rejected by the bench of Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justices J B Pardiwala and Manoj Misra, despite arguments against the decision. The court stated that the reasons given for the transfer were sufficient and that there was little they could do to interfere.

title: Hamas official vows more October 7-like attacks on Israel
description: Ghazi Hamad, a member of Hamas's political bureau, has unabashedly championed the October 7 terror attack. And he has promised similar future assaults with the goal of annihilating Israel. The surprise attack "was just the first time, and there will be a second, a third, a fourth," he told a Lebanese TV channel in an interview that aired on Oct 24 and was later put online by a media watchdog outfit.​​​​Hamad said that Hamas expected more support from its allies in the region, including the Iranian-backed Hezbollah organisation in Lebanon.
